49 class ChemNonEqTTvStateModel : public StateModel
50 {
51 public:
52 
53  //Mutation::Transfer::TransferModel* p_transfer_model;
54 
55  ChemNonEqTTvStateModel(const Thermodynamics& thermo)
56  : StateModel(thermo, 2, thermo.nSpecies())
57  {
58  mp_work1 = new double [thermo.nSpecies()];
59  mp_work2 = new double [thermo.nSpecies()];
60  mp_work3 = new double [thermo.nSpecies()];
61  mp_work4 = new double [thermo.nSpecies()];
62  }
63 
64  ~ChemNonEqTTvStateModel()
65  {
66  delete [] mp_work1;
67  delete [] mp_work2;
68  delete [] mp_work3;
69  delete [] mp_work4;
70  }
71 
79  void setState(
80  const double* const p_mass, const double* const p_energy,
81  const int vars = 0)
82  {
83  const int ns = m_thermo.nSpecies();
84 
85  // Compute the species concentrations which are used through out this
86  // method regardless of variable set. Note that in the case where
87  // the p_mass vector is mass fractions, this is just dividing by the
88  // molecular weights as the first step in converting to mole fractions.
89  double conc = 0.0;
90  for (int i = 0; i < ns; ++i){
91  // Check that species densities are at least positive
92  assert(p_mass[i] >= 0.0 && "Species is negative!");
93  mp_X[i] = std::max(p_mass[i] / m_thermo.speciesMw(i), 0.0);
94  conc += mp_X[i];
95  }
96  double elec = 0.0;
97  if(m_thermo.hasElectrons())
98  elec = mp_X[0];
99 
100  // Compute the temperatures and make sure the variable set is implemented
101  switch (vars) {
102  case 0: {
103 
104  solveEnergies(p_mass, p_energy);
105 
106  break;
107  }
108  case 1:
109  // Check that temperature is at least positive
110  assert(p_energy[0] > 0.0 && "T is negative!");
111  assert(p_energy[1] > 0.0 && "Tv is negative!");
112  m_T = p_energy[0];
113  m_Tv = p_energy[1];
114  break;
115  case 2:
116  // Check temperature and pressure are positive
117  assert(p_energy[0] > 0.0 && "P is negative!");
118  assert(p_energy[1] > 0.0 && "T is negative!");
119  assert(p_energy[2] > 0.0 && "Tv is negative!");
120  m_P = p_energy[0];
121  m_T = p_energy[1];
122  m_Tv = p_energy[2];
123  break;
124  default:
125  throw InvalidInputError("variable set", vars)
126  << "This variable-set is not implemented in ChemNonEqTTv"
127  << ". Possible variable-sets are:\n"
128  << " 0: (species densities, static energy density)\n"
129  << " 1: (species densities, T and Tv)\n"
130  << " 2: (species mass fractions, P, T and Tv)";
131  }
132 
133  // Set Tr, Tel, and Te
134  m_Tr = m_T;
135  m_Tel = m_Te = m_Tv;
136 
137  // Compute the species mole fractions
138  for (int i = 0; i < ns; ++i)
139  mp_X[i] /= conc;
140 
141  // Compute the pressure from T and rho_i
142  if (vars != 2)
143  m_P = conc * RU * (m_T + (m_Tv - m_T) * elec / conc);
144  }
145 
149  void initializeTransferModel(Mutation::Mixture& mix)
150  {
151  typedef Factory<TransferModel> Factory;
152 
153  try {
154  // Heavy particle terms
155  addTransferTerm(0, Factory::create("OmegaVT", mix));
156  addTransferTerm(0, Factory::create("OmegaCV", mix));
157  addTransferTerm(0, Factory::create("OmegaCElec", mix));
158 
159  // Terms only included when electrons are present
160  if (m_thermo.hasElectrons()) {
161  addTransferTerm(0, Factory::create("OmegaET", mix));
162  addTransferTerm(0, Factory::create("OmegaCE", mix));
163  addTransferTerm(0, Factory::create("OmegaI", mix));
164  }
165  } catch (Error& e) {
166  e << "\nWas trying to load a energy transfer model.";
167  throw;
168  }
169  }
170 
171  void getTemperatures(double* const p_T) const {
172  p_T[0] = T();
173  p_T[1] = Tv();
174  }
175 
176  void getEnergiesMass(double* const p_e)
177  {
178  int ns = m_thermo.nSpecies();
179  m_thermo.speciesHOverRT(
180  m_T, m_Tv, m_T, m_Tv, m_Tv, mp_work1, mp_work2, NULL, mp_work3, mp_work4, NULL);
181  int offset = (m_thermo.hasElectrons() ? 1 : 0);
182 
183  for(int i = offset; i < ns; ++i)
184  p_e[i] = (mp_work1[i] - 1.0)*m_T*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(i);
185 
186  for(int i = offset; i < ns; ++i)
187  p_e[i+ns] = (mp_work3[i] + mp_work4[i])*m_T*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(i);
188 
189  if (m_thermo.hasElectrons()) {
190  p_e[0] = (mp_work1[0]*m_T-m_Tv)*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(0);
191  p_e[ns] = (mp_work2[0]*m_T-m_Tv)*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(0);
192  }
193  }
194 
195  void getEnthalpiesMass(double* const p_h)
196  {
197  int ns = m_thermo.nSpecies();
198  m_thermo.speciesHOverRT(mp_work1, mp_work2, NULL, mp_work3, mp_work4, NULL);
199 
200  for(int i = 0; i < ns; ++i)
201  p_h[i] = mp_work1[i]*m_T*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(i);
202  for(int i = 0; i < ns; ++i)
203  p_h[i+ns] = (mp_work3[i] + mp_work4[i])*m_T*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(i);
204  if(m_thermo.hasElectrons())
205  p_h[ns] = mp_work2[0]*m_T*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(0);
206  }
207 
208  void getCpsMass(double* const p_Cp)
209  {
210  int ns = m_thermo.nSpecies();
211  int offset = (m_thermo.hasElectrons() ? 1 : 0);
212  m_thermo.speciesCpOverR(
213  m_T, m_Te, m_Tr, m_Tv, m_Tel, NULL, mp_work1, mp_work2, mp_work3, mp_work4);
214 
215  for(int i = offset; i < ns; ++i)
216  p_Cp[i] = (mp_work1[i]+mp_work2[i])*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(i);
217  for(int i = offset; i < ns; ++i)
218  p_Cp[i+ns] = (mp_work3[i]+mp_work4[i])*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(i);
219  if(m_thermo.hasElectrons()) {
220  p_Cp[0] = 0.0;
221  p_Cp[ns] = mp_work1[0]*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(0);
222  }
223  }
224 
225  void getCvsMass(double* const p_Cv)
226  {
227  int ns = m_thermo.nSpecies();
228  int offset = (m_thermo.hasElectrons() ? 1 : 0);
229  m_thermo.speciesCpOverR(
230  m_T, m_Tv, m_T, m_Tv, m_Tv, NULL, mp_work1, mp_work2, mp_work3, mp_work4);
231 
232  for(int i = offset; i < ns; ++i)
233  p_Cv[i] = (mp_work1[i]+mp_work2[i]-1.0)*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(i);
234  for(int i = offset; i < ns; ++i)
235  p_Cv[i+ns] = (mp_work3[i]+mp_work4[i])*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(i);
236  if(m_thermo.hasElectrons()) {
237  p_Cv[0] = 0.0;
238  p_Cv[ns] = (mp_work1[0]-1.0)*RU/m_thermo.speciesMw(0);
239  }
240  }
241 
242  void getTagModes(int* const p_tag)
243  {
244  p_tag[0] = 1; p_tag[5] = 0; // Heavy translation
245  p_tag[1] = 0; p_tag[6] = 1; // Electron translation
246  p_tag[2] = 1; p_tag[7] = 0; // Rotation excitation
247  p_tag[3] = 0; p_tag[8] = 1; // Vibration excitation
248  p_tag[4] = 0; p_tag[9] = 1; // Electronic excitation
249  }
257  void solveEnergies(const double* const p_rhoi, const double* const p_rhoe)
258  {
259  // This line is required to have perfect numerical jacobians...
260  //m_T = m_Tv = 500.0;
261 
262  const double atol = 1.0e-12;
263  const double rtol = 1.0e-12;
264  const int imax = 100;
265 
266  Map<const VectorXd> rhoi(p_rhoi, m_thermo.nSpecies());
267  const double density = rhoi.sum();
268 
269  static VectorXd yi; yi = rhoi / density;
270  const Vector2d emix = Map<const Vector2d>(p_rhoe) / density;
271 
272  static Matrix<double, Dynamic, Dynamic, RowMajor> ei;
273  static Matrix<double, Dynamic, Dynamic, RowMajor> ci;
274  ei.resize(2, m_thermo.nSpecies());
275  ci.resize(2, m_thermo.nSpecies());
276 
277  getEnergiesMass(ei.data());
278 
279  Vector2d f, e, cv;
280  e = ei*yi;
281  f = e - emix;
282 
283  int i;
284  for (i = 0; (f.norm() > rtol*emix.norm() + atol) && (i < imax); ++i) {
285  // Update temperatures
286  getCvsMass(ci.data());
287  cv = ci*yi;
288 
289  m_Tv = std::max(m_Tv - f[1]/cv[1], 0.1*m_Tv);
290  m_T = std::max(m_T + (f[1]-f[0])/cv[0], 0.1*m_T);
291 
292  // Update function evaluation
293  getEnergiesMass(ei.data());
294  e = ei*yi;
295  f = e - emix;
296  }
297 
298  if (i == imax)
299  std::cout << "Warning, didn't converge temperatures: f = " << f.norm() << std::endl;
300  }
301 
302 
303 private:
304  double* mp_work1;
305  double* mp_work2;
306  double* mp_work3;
307  double* mp_work4;
308 
309 }; // class ChemNonEqStateModel
310

312 Utilities::Config::ObjectProvider<
313  ChemNonEqTTvStateModel, StateModel> chem_non_eq_TTv("ChemNonEqTTv");
